relation: go to movies, go to the ridges, go hiking. socialize with friends on the weekends. whatever you want, options are limitless.
the food is excellent here. the dinning halls are great!

the dorm you have to stay in for the first two years at ohio u. they are nice and well equipped. hey, it is a place to stay dont need to worry about getting all your bedroom and housing stuff down to furnish an apartment or a home. i like the dorm life personally. everyone is different. they are a nice size as well.

any college coarses are going to be tough. some are simple some are tough. the professors are there for you they don't want you to fail. all of them want you to succeed. they are open to any questions or concerns you have. just email or meet with them. depending on the major you decide, the work load or difficulty differs.
come in with high hopes and an open mind. expect anything and everything. accept the experiences that ohio university offers and has to offer.
ohio university is a great school. it has so much to offer and a wide range of major/career opportunities for you to enhance you education. it is a beautiful campus and has a welcoming atmosphere.

TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {883699=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 816021=Every college has sporting events, but one thing Ohio has that those others do not would have to be the Ohio University Marching 110. The 110 performs at all football and basketball games (men and women). They have performed around the world; from Rome and Ireland in 2013 to being invited to perform in China during the 60's. Along with the band though, the university's sports have been performing extremely well over the past few years, including 5 straight bowls for the football team, and a recent Sweet 16 run for the men's basketball team. There are other events that happen on Court Street in Athens, the craziest 1/2 mile in all of Ohio. Home to over 20 bars and a ton of restaurants, there is always something to do in Athens, Ohio!, 339987=I am not familiar with a lot at this time since school just started this week but there is a March 110 that takes all the incoming freshman. The band plays and marches across the main campus bridge with freshman class following them. It is really cool!, 645160=Halloween is HUGE at Ohio University. Rated the best campus to be on in the United States on Oct. 31st.}

textAfterTable: Sari from Columbus, OH 09/14/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 13 out of 15 people found this review useful. 1 person found this inaccurate. 2 of 197 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Ohio University is great for any type of student. There are so many groups, clubs, and other students here, that anyone can find what they are looking for. Tips for prospective students For those of you thinking of coming here to OU here are a few tips: 1. GO TO CLASS. This is probably the most important thing to do because, now that we are on our own, we have many distractions and fun things to do. However, you are here to get an education and the best way to do that is going to class. 2. Study: To do well on test and exams, do your work and study so that you will be prepared. Also by study you will most likely get better grades, making your parents happy and keeping you off academic probation. Bang for the buck
